qas.question: The study of diseases caused by immune system disorders is called?
What are three problems of the immune system studied by clinical immunology?

answers.text: failure, aberrant action, and malignant growth

qas.question: Where can these three elements occur in the immune system?
What else does clinical immunology concern itself with?
Why does clinical immunology extend to those areas?

answers.text: immune reactions play a part in the pathology and clinical features

context: <a0_0>Clinical immunology<a0_0/> is the study of diseases caused by disorders of the immune system (<a1_0>failure, aberrant action, and malignant growth<a1_0/> of the <a2_0>cellular elements<a2_0/> of the system). It also involves <a3_0>diseases of other systems<a3_0/>, where <a4_0>immune reactions play a part in the pathology and clinical features<a4_0/>.
